articles.title: "Give Me Back My Right To Live Without Fear And In Peace": Bilkis Bano
articles.description: Bilkis Bano said the release of the men convicted of raping her and killing her family "has taken from me my peace and shaken my faith in justice."
articles.content:
Bilkis Bano requested the Gujarat government to revoke the move.
New Delhi: Bilkis Bano, the survivor of one of the most horrific rape cases during the 2002 Gujarat riots, has said the release of th… [+2802 chars]

articles.title: Don’t mislead public on allopathy: Delhi HC to Ramdev
articles.description: The court directed the yoga guru to refrain from making unsubstantiated claims while speaking in favour of Patanjali product Coronil. | Latest News India

articles.title: Afghanistan: At Least 21 Killed, Many Wounded As Huge Blast Rips Through Mosque in Kabul
articles.description: The blast took place during the evening prayers at the mosque located in a northern Kabul neighbourhood. The explosion was so powerful that it shattered windows in nearby buildings
articles.content: A massive explosion ripped through a mosque in Afghanistans Kabul on Wednesday evening, leaving at least 21 dead. The blast took place during the evening prayers at the mosque located in a northern K… [+1352 chars]

articles.title: Delhi kept in dark: Manish Sisodia accuses Centre of 'conspiring' to settle Rohingyas
articles.description: Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia alleged the Centre made a U-turn on providing flats to Rohingya refugees and then blamed it on the city government.
articles.content: Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia on Wednesday claimed the Central government has prepared a blueprint to permanently settle Rohingyas in EWS flats in Bakkarwala, Delhi. Manish Sisodia accused the… [+4529 chars]

articles.description: The under-construction, much-delayed Karam Dam in Dhar district is one of many being probed, BJP government has said; scam pegged at Rs 3,000 crore; minister says won't spare guilty "even if from our party"

articles.title: Bihar: Asked to surrender in kidnapping case, Kartikeya Singh instead took oath as law minister | Exclusive
articles.description: A day after Chief Minister Nitish Kumar expanded his new cabinet on Tuesday by inducting 31 new ministers, including a huge contingent of 16 from key ally RJD, controversy has erupted over the induction of RJD MLC Kartikeya Singh as the law minister of the st…
articles.content:
• Controversy has erupted over induction of RJD MLC Kartikeya Singh
  • He has been divested of law ministry in the state
  • A case of kidnapping has been registered against Singh
